seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server provides multi-user connectivity to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases within a single system or over a network.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server provides multi-user connectivity to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases within a single system or over a network.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server provides multi-user connectivity to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases within a single system or over a network.

trans-unit.source: The Network Server uses the standard Distributed Relational Database Architecture (DRDA) protocol to receive and reply to queries from clients. Databases are accessed through the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server by using the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Client driver.

seg-source.mrk: The Network Server uses the standard Distributed Relational Database Architecture (DRDA) protocol to receive and reply to queries from clients.
Databases are accessed through the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server by using the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Client driver.

target.mrk: The Network Server uses the standard Distributed Relational Database Architecture (DRDA) protocol to receive and reply to queries from clients.
Databases are accessed through the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server by using the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Client driver.

trans-unit.source: The Network Server is a solution for multiple JVMs that connect to the database, unlike the embedded scenario where only one JVM runs as part of the system. When <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is embedded in a single-JVM application, the embedded JDBC driver calls the local <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database. When <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is embedded in a server framework, the server framework's connectivity software provides data to multiple client JDBC applications over a network or the Internet.

seg-source.mrk: The Network Server is a solution for multiple JVMs that connect to the database, unlike the embedded scenario where only one JVM runs as part of the system.

When <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is embedded in a single-JVM application, the embedded JDBC driver calls the local <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database.

When <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is embedded in a server framework, the server framework's connectivity software provides data to multiple client JDBC applications over a network or the Internet.

target.mrk: The Network Server is a solution for multiple JVMs that connect to the database, unlike the embedded scenario where only one JVM runs as part of the system.

When <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is embedded in a single-JVM application, the embedded JDBC driver calls the local <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database.

When <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is embedded in a server framework, the server framework's connectivity software provides data to multiple client JDBC applications over a network or the Internet.

trans-unit.source: On the server side, install <codeph>derby.jar</codeph> and <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: On the server side, install <codeph>derby.jar</codeph> and <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph>.

target.mrk: On the server side, install <codeph>derby.jar</codeph> and <codeph>derbynet.jar</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: On the client side, install <codeph>derbyclient.jar</codeph>.

target.mrk: On the client side, install <codeph>derbyclient.jar</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: Because of the differences in JDBC drivers that are used, you might encounter differences in functionality when running <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> in the Network Server framework as opposed to running it embedded in a user application. Refer to <xref href="cadminapps59125.dita#cadminapps59125"></xref> for a complete list of the differences between embedded and Network Server configurations.
